conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source, casting A, B, C and D on the ground.
The image shows: A lamp (with shadow A), a cookie or pastry item (with shadow B), a cake or dessert on a plate (with shadow C), another object out of frame (with shadow D).
The objects are illuminated from above, creating shadows on the wooden floor.

When a light source casts shadows: Shadows form in the direction opposite to the light source, shadow size depends on: distance between object and surface, object size, and distance between light source and object, shadow position changes based on the relative position of light source and object.

premise: When the light source moves forward (toward the objects)
conclusion: All shadows will move closer to being directly beneath their respective objects.

premise: When the light source moves forward (toward the objects)
conclusion: The shadows will shift backward (away from the direction the light is moving).

premise: When the light source moves forward (toward the objects)
